docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 28 -- Prince Wan Waithayakon, Foreign Minister of Thailand, told the United Nations General Assembly today his Government was gravely concerned over the situation in Southeast Asia despite the Indochina armistice.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 28 -- Prince Wan Waithayakon, Foreign Minister of Thailand, told the United Nations General Assembly today his Government was gravely concerned over the situation in Southeast Asia despite the Indochina armistice.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 1 -- A sharp Latin-American protest against the United Nations handling of the Guatemalan case was heard today by the General Assembly.

docs.snippet: British sterling moved erratically last week. Under the weight of dollar purchases in London, the pound sold down to $2.79 1/32, on Monday and Tuesday. This was the lowest since October, 1952.
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling moved erratically last week. Under the weight of dollar purchases in London, the pound sold down to $2.79 1/32, on Monday and Tuesday. This was the lowest since October, 1952.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Oct. 1, 1954

docs.snippet: United Merchants and Manufacturers, Inc., manufacturer and distributor of textiles, commercial factor and operator of the Robert Hall Clothes, Inc., chain, improved its sales in the fiscal year ended June 30. Earnings, however, were slightly lower...
docs.lead_paragraph: United Merchants and Manufacturers, Inc., manufacturer and distributor of textiles, commercial factor and operator of the Robert Hall Clothes, Inc., chain, improved its sales in the fiscal year ended June 30. Earnings, however, were slightly lower than in the preceding fiscal year.

headline.main: SALES UP, NET OFF FOR TEXTILE HOUSE; $9,161,569 Earned by United Merchants-Manufacturers on $343,010,088 Volume COMPANIES ISSUE EARNINGS FIGURES

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 6 -- The United Nations General Assembly rejected tonight a demand by the Soviet Union for immediate consideration of its complaint that Nationalist China was guilty of "piratical" actions.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 6 -- The United Nations General Assembly rejected tonight a demand by the Soviet Union for immediate consideration of its complaint that Nationalist China was guilty of "piratical" actions.
docs.abstract: Assembly, 55-0, puts USSR plan on agenda as separate item, refers it to Pol and Security Com

headline.main: SOVIET REBUFFED IN U.N. ON 'PIRACY'; Assembly Rejects Vishinsky's Demand for Quick Hearing on Formosa's Blockade

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON -- The two main themes of the Ninth General Assembly of the International Union of Travel Organizations which met in London recently were (1) the importance of tourism as a source of foreign exchange and a factor in the international balance...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON -- The two main themes of the Ninth General Assembly of the International Union of Travel Organizations which met in London recently were (1) the importance of tourism as a source of foreign exchange and a factor in the international balance of payments, and (2) the gradual elimination of such barriers to travel as visas, passports, restrictive currency arrangements and frontier formalities.

headline.main: PROMOTING TRAVEL; Delegates From More Than 50 Nations Attend London Meeting on Tourism

docs.snippet: British sterling made slow but steady progress upward last week from the irregularity which had previously depressed it to the lowest in the last two years. Dealers attributed the rally to a natural rebound and the dissipation of earlier pressures.
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling made slow but steady progress upward last week from the irregularity which had previously depressed it to the lowest in the last two years. Dealers attributed the rally to a natural rebound and the dissipation of earlier pressures.
